abstract.p: Rick Berchiolli letter on R Albert Mohler Jr's June 19 article questions Southern Baptist crusade against modernity

It is interesting that R. Albert Mohler Jr., in his June 19 Op-Ed article in defense of the Southern Baptist crusade against modernity, alludes to the 19th-century liberal theologian Friedrich Schleiermacher, who created a space for modern sensibilities and traditional views of Christianity to coexist.

More puzzling is how Mr. Mohler attributes the ills of society exclusively to the undercurrents of modernity. For at least three decades, American culture has witnessed the diminishing influence of modernity as the opposing strands of postmodernity take hold in areas ranging from architecture to ethics. It could be an empty victory for Mr. Mohler and Southern Baptists if they ultimately triumph against modernity only to discover that the battle has moved on without them.
